title: Ticket #2929: If NEGOTIATOR_HOST is set, then Condor is unable to locate negotiator
description:
If NEGOTIATOR_HOST is set, then Condor is unable to find the location of the negotiator (it appears to take a different code path in src/condor_daemon_client/daemon.cpp and never query the collector).

This appears to be somehow related to the removal of the default negotiator port, but I can't quite detangle the code to figure out how.

Various things that break:

  • condor_reschedule
  • condor_q -better-analyze
  • condor_reconfig -negotiator
remarks:
2012-Apr-09 13:11:19 by matt:
condor_reschedule reportedly produces an error in the SchedLog 

$ _CONDOR_NEGOTIATOR_HOST=$(hostname) condor_reconfig -neg
Can't connect to local negotiator
$ condor_status -neg -l | grep Address
MyAddress = "<192.168.122.1:57978>"
$ _CONDOR_NEGOTIATOR_HOST=$(hostname):57978 condor_reconfig -neg
Sent "Reconfig" command to local negotiator

http://research.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/3_3Configuration.html#15447

NEGOTIATOR_HOST - This configuration variable is no longer used. It previously defined the host name of the machine where the condor_negotiator is running. At present, the port where the condor_negotiator is listening is dynamically allocated.

I assume this has been broken since the Negotiator got an ephemeral port.

This is a little landmine. I'd support removing NEGOTIATOR_HOST configuration.

2012-Apr-11 10:47:20 by tannenba:
Proposed fix: Remove NEGOTIATOR_HOST from the code, from the manual.
